title: Add supported library docs callout
body:
Bottom line: explicitly document that third party JavaScript libraries like Prototype and jQuery UI aren't supported.

/cc @cvrebert

title: Include docs mention of supported LESS compilers
body:
We should explicitly document that LESS compilers other than less.js aren't supported. Perhaps in the readme and in the actual docs.

/cc @cvrebert

title: Update docs to better call out container option
body:
To prevent further duplications and problems with implementation, we should call out the `{container: 'body'}` option better in our docs. Included should be a mention in the button groups section to help connect the dots for folks.

/cc @cvrebert

title: closed modal box covers clickable elements
body:
I have an icon on the page where I wire a click event. Further down in the page, I have a series of Bootstrap Modal divs. Problem: When the page opens, the (hidden) modal covers the icon, and it cannot be click. If I open and close the modal, the icon is now available. I hacked a fix by doing an open / close in javascript while the page is opening. But this seems dumb. Surely there is some setting that will make this work without a hack. Here is part of the html (with knockout): ``` html

Was this search result useful?

title: .table-bordered doesn't render for printing in Chrome properly
body:
table.table-bordered works fine for viewing, but in printing, only the first and last rows have the thick gray left border.  All other rows have a thin left border.

To reproduce, load http://twitter.github.io/bootstrap/base-css.html#tables in Chrome 27.0.1453.94 m, right-click and go to Print... and look at the .table-bordered example on page 13.

![bootstrap1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1045568/700184/e24a5eb8-dd3b-11e2-838f-08dfb0cd6924.png)

title: Fix justified nav example
Added an interactive color swatch to customize page
body:
#### UX Problem

The Customize page does not provide an effective interface for interacting with the variables.less file. 

#### Proposed Solution
Add a simple color swatch next to each of the options in the Bootstrap 3.x color selection section.

#### Motivation
There have been a number of requests both on the 2.x and 3.x branches to add interactivity but thus far there have been no pull requests that I have seen. E.g. [2804](https://github.com/twitter/bootstrap/issues/2804), [2578](https://github.com/twitter/bootstrap/issues/2578) etc.

#### Complexity
There is slightly more complex markup but it's only from using a bootstrap row/col to controll collapsing in different viewports.

	JavaScript: +9 lines  
	CSS:       +11 lines  
	HTML:       +7 lines/color  

#### Drawbacks
Since the `attr(data-color px)` style CSS selectors are still not that well implemented I had to use a little inline styling. Maybe the community can help find a better solution.

title: Cross-Over effect on carousel?
body:
Hey there,

I was wondering if there was any possibility of using a crossover-like effect on the carousel instead of the swipe-like effect that's currently being used.

I'm currently only using 2.3.2 (didn't look at 3.0 as of now), but I would be interested if something like it would be possible in future releases.

The Swipe-effect is really nice and clean, but sometimes you just want to use a crossover effect because it fits better or for whatever other reason.

Is it possible? :)

title: e.preventDefault() on tooltip/popover toggle
body:
When the tooltip is created on an anchor element with an href the default event is not prevented. This is annoying as i have quite a lot of popovers as progressive enhancement but if no javascript is present, the user is sent to the correct page. Now I am doing another 'click' listener which prevents the default behaviour and then fires the popover (much like the twitter bootrap demo page does) but I guess it would be nice to have that behaviour directly in the bootstrap js.

#6500 was submitted some time ago but was rejected for not working with the -wip branches

title: Are there any plans for moving all specific properties to main variables.less?
body:
Hi Guy, 
          I have been following v3.0 for couple of months now, and I was really v. glad you are going to do major changes for better and cool @bootstrap.

Anyway, I was curious whether  you are going to change old v2.0.0 style of putting specific properties values in inner less files instead of variables.less.

As users like me change almost all colors on each and every new project, and keeping things consistent with new updates becomes nightmare. So I was wondering if you are going to change that route and move all property values (mostly color related and some fonts related as well, from specific files) to variables.less

For example (v3.0)
accordion.less
.accordion-group {}
border: 1px solid #e5e5e5;
could be
border: @border-width-small solid @accordion-group-border-color;

or even instead of solid (@border-style-one, or @border-style-two etc etc)

Hope you catch my drift?

Without this v3.0 will be not so shiny, as this will rock v3.0 because I have been and still see people asking how to override core styles without loosing upgrade on stackoverflow etc etc.

I found you have done is already at several places but I would like to see complete overhaul of this.

Hope its useful.

title: Fixed event name when modal is shown or hidden
Navbar brand padding should be calculated with @navbar-height value.
body:
I have seen #6952 not sure if this was the exact same issue, the answer was that this would be redone in 3.0 but now it's not calculated at all. It's hardcoded to 15px now and I think this should not be this way.

So when I change the @navbar-height: 50px to 35px for example the Brand still has this 15px default padding resulting in forcing the navbar to stay the defaut height and only the navbar-nav is smaller.
![bs_nav](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1780826/669623/12a6ac1c-d830-11e2-84ec-5b4ceaf5e951.png)

This is the default inverse navbar of 3.0 except that the brand has a different font. @navbar-height is 35px and all 3 Items are in active state.

I used the class ```.well``` to illustrate a container that has min-height and padding. In such a case, the container doesn't fully hide.

title: Rename responsive breakpoint variables
body:
Rename the variables that set the responsive media-query breakpoints to use the v3 naming scheme (e.g. screen-sm, screen-md, etc) and remove redundant v2 names (e.g. screen-tablet).

Updates the breakpoint names in variables.less to make clear how the bounds for each screen size are being set.

(Makes no functional change to output.)

title: fix bug of issue 8134(Carousel sliding with data-interval="false")
body:
This bug is because when we call carousel like `$("#content").carousel()`, the `$.fn.carousel` function is called.

But this function does not check the option in HTML attributes, it only extend the option in arguments and the default option. Which means, if we set the `data-interval="false"`, and call `$("#content").carousel()`, the `interval` will be set to default value 5000, but not false.

I extend `$this.data()` to option object. The bug is fixed.

title: Radio buttons in disabled and checked state disappear in iOS Safari

title: Missing .modal-backdrop.fade transitions preventing modal to appear
body:
When downloading [customized](http://twitter.github.io/bootstrap/customize.html) Bootstrap with Modal and Transitions `.modal-backdrop.fade` class does not contain transitions (`-webkit-transition`, `-moz-transition` and so on). But this prevents modal from appearing when using `fade` class because of relying on `webkittransitionend` event. Check [bootstrap-modal.js](https://github.com/twitter/bootstrap/blob/v2.3.2/js/bootstrap-modal.js) file on line [184](https://github.com/twitter/bootstrap/blob/v2.3.2/js/bootstrap-modal.js#L184):

```
          $.support.transition && this.$element.hasClass('fade')?
            this.$backdrop.one($.support.transition.end, callback) :
            callback()
```

Bootstrap attach a callback that actualy displays a modal to `webkittransitionend` (on Chrome) event. But `webkittransitionend` event never occurs as there is no transitions in CSS.

title: Bootstrap navs.less files hard codes colors ignoring variables.less
body:
When website is shrunk to cell phone the system reverts to 'nav' controls.  Unfortunately many of the font colors in the file navs.less are hard coded, instead of being based on variables defined in variables.less file.   Makes it difficult to change menu appearance.    (I'm using twitter-bootstrap-v2.3.2-1-g60b202d )

I would think that best practice should be to define variables in variables.less and then compile bootstrap.css

ref: 
.nav > li > a:focus {...

.nav-header {...

.nav-list > .active > a,
.nav-list > .active > a:hover,
.nav-list > .active > a:focus {...

title: Constant form data and semantics of disabled/readonly
body:
I am a big user of `.form-horizontal` `
`s. They allow me to beautifully present slightly longer forms in a table-like visual structure. A common pattern that I use is that I would like to present static/constant data within my form. A use case is that I have an account page where I don't allow changing the username, but would allow the user to change the password. Other examples are database ID:s, UUID:s etc. My guess that this is also a common use case for other Bootstrap users. One solution to overcome the above issue would be to simply set `disabled="disabled"` or `readonly="readonly"`. My issue with these solutions is twofold: * By the look of them, they both hint to my user that there is a way to edit the username. They both kinda look like input boxes, but are grayed out and inmodifiable. * As of semantics, they are both contained in `` tags. As a developer, it feels weird putting constants in `` tags. They are clearly not input. Another possible solution (modified from the documentation) is ```html
JensRantil
``` which yields ![screenshot3](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/730342/642297/45856248-d355-11e2-8937-37c72555edb4.png) . As you can see, `form.form-horizontal` has artefacts for constant text. I've been visiting reading the [W3C spec for `disabled`/`readonly`](http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/interact/forms.html#h-17.12) to understand their semantic intent, but the description is very technical. So far, I haven't understood whether any of them should cover my case. If `disabled` is for the case of presenting constants, then I would propose Boostrap would style `input:disabled` as regular text without borders etc. However since I can't defer that from the spec, **my proposal is a class that avoids the artefact in the screenshot, a `.controls.controls-static` class with correct margin.**. I'd love to hear your input on this.
